title: Citi Handlowy to Receive EUR 30M for Financing Investments in Energy Efficiency
summary: Warsaw - On December 12, Witold Zielinski, Vice President of Citi Handlowy's Management Board and Katarzyna Bajerowska, Head of Cash Management and Trade Financing Products, and Markus Schmidtchen and Joachim Vonalt, Ph.D., of KfW, signed the agreement under which Citi Handlowy is to obtain EUR 30 million for the financing of investments aimed at increasing energy efficiency. This is the first energy-efficiency program signed in Poland with the KfW bank, one of two providers of funds allocated for energy efficiency (under the SME program and Municipal Finance Facility Energy Efficiency Window).
tag-1: Citi Handlowy to Receive EUR 30M for Financing Investments in Energy Efficiency
tag-2: Warsaw – On December 12, Witold Zielinski, Vice President of Citi Handlowy's Management Board and Katarzyna Bajerowska, Head of Cash Management and Trade Financing Products, and Markus Schmidtchen and Joachim Vonalt, Ph.D., of KfW, signed the agreement under which Citi Handlowy is to obtain EUR 30 million for the financing of investments aimed at increasing energy efficiency. This is the first energy-efficiency program signed in Poland with the KfW bank, one of two providers of funds allocated for energy efficiency (under the SME program and Municipal Finance Facility Energy Efficiency Window).
tag-3: Monika Ledzion, Director of the European Union Unit at Citi Handlowy, said: "For many years, we have had a special service in our offer that has been addressed to companies interested in EU funds. The latest agreement contracted with KfW constitutes the next step bringing that valuable possibility of financial support, offered by EU projects, closer to our clients. On this occasion, we have prepared a special offer for those interested in the program – a redemption of 10 percent of the principal of the loan, which they have at our bank."
tag-4: KfW bank's SME Energy Efficiency Program and Municipal Energy Efficiency Program are programs under which KfW, on behalf of the EU and in cooperation with Council of Europe Development Bank (CEB), provide funds and knowledge facilitating investments in energy efficiency to small and medium-sized enterprises (SME) and to public entities (PS). KfW programs are aimed at encouraging enterprises from the SME sector / local government entities to take decisions concerning investments in energy efficiency as well as at encouraging banks operating in countries where the program is conducted to broaden their offer by including financing investments in energy efficiency.
tag-5: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citigroup provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-7: Bank Handlowy w Warszawie S.A. Bank Handlowy w Warszawie S.A. is one of the major financial institutions in Poland offering under the Citi Handlowy brand a broad range of state-of-the-art corporate, investment and consumer banking products. Through its modern distribution channels and a network of 88 branches, Bank Handlowy provides services to 20,000 corporate customers and 869,000 retail customers. The Bank's capital group includes Dom Maklerski Banku Handlowego (brokerage house) and Handlowy Leasing. Being a member of Citi, the world's largest financial institution, enables the customers of Bank Handlowy access to financial services provided in over 100 countries all over the world.
tag-8: Further information is available at www.citihandlowy.pl.
